aspace_helpers.title: CPF export behaves differently on staging and prod

comments.body:
Issue can be reproduced by exporting the CPF for
https://aspace-staging.princeton.edu/staff/agents/agent_person/10748 and
https://aspace.princeton.edu/staff/agents/agent_person/10748
respectively.
I've emailed Lyrasis to ask whether it is possible that, despite both servers being on the same version, the exporter on staging could be behind.

Aha! This is a CVL issue. The value as entered from the drop-down is mapped to the controlled values allowed by the CPF schema. CPF requires them to be upper case, whereas our CVL maps them to the correct, but lower-case values.
It turns out we have a locales file only on staging that overrides the mapping. Lyrasis is going to delete it for us; changes should take effect after a re-start tonight.

dpul.title: Item Carousel Widget is broken for MVWs

comments.body:
We found that non-MVWs have a value for iiif_tilesource once they're saved by trevor, but MVWs do not. This makes https://github.com/projectblacklight/spotlight/blob/main/app/views/spotlight/sir_trevor/blocks/_solr_documents_carousel_block.html.erb#L13 work for non-mvws, and a larger image is displayed. Note that neither is getting the full_image_url value.

That all happens in https://github.com/projectblacklight/spotlight/blob/main/app/javascript/spotlight/admin/iiif.js

But it seems too hard to make that work for MVWs. We're already doing it on the ruby side, so let's use what we already have.

Plan:

1. write a test on the autocomplete endpoint to ensure it returns a full_image_url. Maybe add something around https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/blob/403a9311d1ec21d1544588fcc5ad1e4ed5c8fa4e/spec/features/catalog_spec.rb#L66
1. Make autocomplete return full_image_url_ssm by setting the field list in the initializer. Add a `fl` to the setting as seen in https://github.com/projectblacklight/spotlight/blob/a29b6bd3dc1e97fcc8f49a0273c90516af4d3f49/lib/generators/spotlight/templates/config/initializers/spotlight_initializer.rb#L32
1. Index the full image url at a slightly larger size. see https://github.com/pulibrary/dpul/blob/403a9311d1ec21d1544588fcc5ad1e4ed5c8fa4e/app/services/iiif_manifest.rb#L43-L47

dspace-development.title: Import dissertations records for March 2023 into DataSpace
Identify and resolve the Workflow Item issues for 46830

comments.body:
> You're welcome, thank you again.
> 
> Just to ensure that the activity on this issue is logged, this bug was related to a misconfigured workflow step applied to the parent Collection. The Accept/Reject step must be deleted.
> 
> ![image.png](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/557d22c4c2b31e0d706875566687dae51f13f64497035b481533791e62a599a8/68747470733a2f2f696d616765732e7a656e68756275736572636f6e74656e742e636f6d2f3562356236616564393831633332303463396564303663382f35623763383232632d303932312d343865312d386635382d323261373664626235323539)
> 
> ![image.png](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/e7097c94dcea11fe8dd9a3420fba996656ce2cd87e1e0eef9da700c74163f661/68747470733a2f2f696d616765732e7a656e68756275736572636f6e74656e742e636f6d2f3562356236616564393831633332303463396564303663382f33373437306536612d313632382d343439392d396138642d626236333532383036353030)
> 
> This has occurred elsewhere, and much of this configuration has been either inherited from the legacy system (which was migrated from the original OIT infrastructure), or, it is possible that during the migration certain configuration settings may not have been properly set for the new deployments.

Computational Sciences was one that was created recently so it's possible that I made the mistake, so I will take onus on my error. It was one of the first collections that I created. Though I'm not sure why PS&T is impacted here as it has been around for a while.

figgy.title: Manifests are generated even when there are no image files

comments.body: Another potential use case would be for the Ephemera stakeholders to answer. we do not have  a use case documented (yet), but probably worth a discussion with them too?

I think the issue here is that GraphQL is returning manifest URLs for resources that have no members. It's also true that the manifest URL should probably not return a JSON document for things without members, but I think in the current scenario if we just did that then the viewer would error and still display.

okay! üëçüèª
excited to see this bug squashed!

figgy.title: Design pass on File Browser component and its integration

comments.body:
To do:

- [x] Adjust bulk ingest so the folder field is first, style it like a disabled text input with a folder icon next to it.
- [x] Add a header to the Modal to remind folks what they're doing (Select Files for Ingest) or (Select Folder for Bulk Ingest)
- [x] Improve the select folder help modal for bulk ingest.
- [x] Use tabs for local vs server upload in File Manager to make it clear that they're not one thing.
- [x] For pending uploads, use a header at the top that says "Files Queued for Ingest"
- [x] For file manager, add two buttons that open up sections for Server and Local ingest. For server ingest, make it just render the file picker and "Ingest X" will actually ingest, no additional button clicks.
![Screen Shot 2023-04-05 at 12 28 56 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2806645/230185127-88fdff23-db97-4755-ae0c-23f8f192d5c7.png)

orangelight.title: Reformat description for numismatics fields in show page

comments.body:
@kelea99 . I see that the fields display as they were requested. 

Obverse Figure Description: figure, part, orientation, description

_We display_:
 "issue_obverse_description_s": [
    "Hercules, head, right, lionskin headdress"
  ],

_We concat in the requested order_:
  "issue_obverse_figure_s": [
    "Hercules"
  ],
  "issue_obverse_part_s": [
    "head"
  ],
  "issue_obverse_orientation_s": [
    "right"
  ],
  "issue_obverse_figure_description_s": [
    "lionskin headdress"

Reverse Figure Description:  figure, part, orientation, description 

_We display:_
 issue_reverse_description_s": [
    "Jupiter, seated, left, seated on throne, legs crossed, eagle in r. hand, sceptre in l. hand"
  ],

_We concat in the requested order:_

"issue_reverse_figure_s": [
    "Jupiter"
  ],
  "issue_reverse_part_s": [
    "seated"
  ],
  "issue_reverse_orientation_s": [
    "left"
  ],
  "issue_reverse_figure_description_s": [
    "seated on throne, legs crossed, eagle in r. hand, sceptre in l. hand"
  ],
This was done.
